decks.notes: The focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy with counterspells and removal spells while generating card advantage through card draw and card selection. The deck aims to control the game by utilizing powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk, backed up by efficient creature removal and disruptive tactics. By efficiently responding to the opponent's threats and maintaining card advantage, the deck aims to take over the game and secure victory through a combination of counter magic and tempo control.

This deck focuses on utilizing the power of Paradoxical Outcome to draw a large number of cards and generate a significant amount of mana to set up a powerful combo finish. By leveraging cards like Mishra's Workshop, Urza's Saga, and Grim Monolith, the deck aims to quickly generate mana and assemble key pieces like Time Vault and The One Ring. With the ability to manipulate artifacts and draw cards efficiently, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with a strong combo finish.

The deck revolves around utilizing artifacts and spells to generate a large amount of mana, draw cards, and assemble a powerful combo involving various key pieces such as Tinker, The One Ring, Time Vault, and Paradoxical Outcome. The goal is to generate enough resources to generate infinite turns or create a dominant board presence that overwhelms the opponent quickly. The deck also includes control elements such as Force of Will and Trinisphere to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's strategies.

The deck focuses on using artifacts and powerful mana sources to generate enough mana to cast key combo pieces like Paradoxical Outcome and Tinker to pull off a game-winning combo. The deck also utilizes cards like Grim Monolith and Urza's Saga to ramp up the mana production while including disruptive elements like Force of Will to protect the combo. The inclusion of cards like Coveted Jewel and Mystic Forge adds additional synergy and value to the deck, providing a versatile gameplay experience that can overwhelm opponents with a powerful combo finish.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy while maintaining card advantage. By utilizing powerful control cards like Force of Will and Wasteland, along with efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Caustic Bronco, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan. Additionally, with the help of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion, the deck can continuously recur smaller threats and maintain pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Time Vault also provide additional win conditions for the deck.

The deck focuses on quickly putting cards into the graveyard to trigger powerful effects like Bridge from Below and Creeping Chill. The goal is to use cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder to fill the graveyard with key cards like Ichorid and Golgari Thug, allowing for explosive plays with creatures like Hollow One and Prized Amalgam. With disruption in the form of Force of Will and Cabal Therapy, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a flood of creatures and graveyard synergies to win the game quickly.

This deck focuses on playing disruptive creatures that hate on the opponent's strategies while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan by taxing their spells and disrupting their mana base, ultimately overwhelming them with early threats. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats quickly to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. The deck utilizes hatebears to disrupt the opponent's interactions and punish them for playing noncreature spells, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures to end the game quickly.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize aggressive creatures like Basking Rootwalla, Blazing Rootwalla, and Vengevine to quickly overwhelm the opponent while using cards like Noxious Revival and Poxwalkers for graveyard recursion. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Negation and Force of Will to protect its game plan, along with land destruction cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Additionally, the deck utilizes the powerful draw engine of Bazaar of Baghdad to consistently find its key creatures and spells.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful cards like Urza's Saga, Force of Will, and Wasteland to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes key combo pieces like Time Vault and Manifold Key for a game-winning combo. With a mix of card draw, counterspells, and removal, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value and recursion, while efficient threats like Orcish Bowmasters and Caustic Bronco pressure the opponent's life total.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on using powerful artifacts like Wasteland, Black Lotus, and Moxen to generate mana advantage and control the board. It features a mix of disruption spells like Force of Will and Force of Negation, along with card draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. The deck also includes several key pieces for combo potential, such as Time Vault and Lurrus of the Dream-Den for recursion. Ultimately, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win conditions through card advantage and strategic plays.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo pieces necessary to cast Doomsday and win the game in a single turn. It features a mix of fast mana acceleration, card draw, countermagic, and tutors to find and protect the key cards needed for the combo. By resolving Doomsday and setting up the perfect stack of cards, the deck aims to win the game through a combination of drawing cards and manipulating the library, ultimately leading to a win condition with Thassa's Oracle.

This deck focuses on using disruptive creatures and spells like Deathrite Shaman and Collector Ouphe to slow down the opponent while deploying threats like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Tarmogoyf to apply pressure. The deck also utilizes powerful card draw and manipulation spells such as Ancestral Recall, Brainstorm, and Dig Through Time to maintain card advantage and find key pieces. With a mix of blue, black, and green cards, this BUG (blue, black, green) Midrange deck aims to control the game until it can overwhelm the opponent with its threats and disruption.

The key focus of this deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing powerful spells and a combination of artifacts like Time Vault and Manifold Key. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Wasteland and Force of Will, while maintaining card advantage with Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a companion to provide additional value and recursion. By efficiently managing resources and countering threats, the Dimir Control deck seeks to outmaneuver the opponent and secure victory through strategic gameplay.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 Combo - Paradoxical Outcome deck revolves around utilizing powerful artifacts such as Mishra's Workshop, Grim Monolith, and Coveted Jewel to generate mana and draw cards with Paradoxical Outcome. The key strategy is to assemble a game-winning combination of cards like Karn, the Great Creator, The One Ring, and Time Vault to create an unbeatable board state. The deck also includes counter spells like Force of Will to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a focus on fast mana and explosive plays, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory quickly.
